pageContext.claim: “And Nevada is a big state. It's an important state. It's a very political state, and the governor happens to be a Democrat. And I don't believe the Post Office can be set up. They were given no notice. I mean, you're talking about millions of votes. No, it'll be a -- it's a catastrophe waiting to happen.”
pageContext.analysis: Nevada's top election official, Secretary of State Barbara Cegavske, is a Republican. The state's Democratic governor has no say in Cegavske's decision to expand mail-in voting to mitigate the spread of the novel coronavirus at traditional polling locations, as other states run by Republicans and Democrats are doing this year.
